intro: Hieracium microglossum, commonly known as the small-lipped hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk, and the leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
